required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: REPAIR - transcatheteR rEPair of mitrAl Insufficiency With caRdioband System
clinical_study.official_title: REPAIR - transcatheteR rEPair of mitrAl Insufficiency With caRdioband System

brief_summary.textblock:
The Cardioband Transcatheter System (Cardioband) is indicated for the treatment of secondary (functional) mitral regurgitation (FMR). The Cardioband is a transcatheter system, deployed on the beating heart through a transseptal approach. The Cardioband is deployed along the posterior annulus of the mitral valve (MV) and is adjusted under trans-esophageal guidance on the beating heart. A CE mark study with 30 subjects has been completed and documented reduction of severity of mitral regurgitation (MR) and improvement in 6- minute walk test in subjects with moderate to severe MR.
Study objectives are to test the efficacy of the Cardioband in improving MR and heart failure symptoms in patients with symptomatic (New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class III-IVa), severe MR in the post-marketing setting, And to evaluate the safety of the Cardioband system in the post-marketing setting.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Edwards acquired Valtech Cardio Ltd in 2017 and opted to replace this study with NCT03600688.11 patients were enrolled in REPAIR and follow-up is complete.

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in Severity of MR at 30 Days of at Least One Category on a 0-4 Scale.
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of Patients with Reduction in MR Severity of at least one grade at 30 days compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Distance Walked on 6 Minute Walk Test
secondary_outcome.description: Median distance in meters walked during 6 Minute Walk Test (6MWT) at 6 months compared to baseline
Mitral Regurgitation at 6, 12, and 24 months compared to baseline

other_outcome.measure: Change in Distance Walked on 6 Minute Walk Test
other_outcome.description: Median distance in meters walked during 6 Minute Walk Test (6MWT) at 12 and 24 months compared to baseline

other_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life (QoL) as Measured by the Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire (KCCQ)
other_outcome.description: Median KCCQ Score. The KCCQ is a 23-item, self-administered instrument that quantifies physical function, symptoms (frequency, severity and recent change), social function, self-efficacy and knowledge, and quality of life. Scores range from 0-100, in which higher scores reflect better health status.

other_outcome.measure: Change in New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class
other_outcome.description: NYHA Class at 6, 12, and 24 months compared to baseline

other_outcome.measure: Change in Left Ventricular End Diastolic Volume (LVEDV)
other_outcome.description: Median LVEDV data, as measured by TTE at 6, 12, and 24 months compared to baseline

other_outcome.measure: Change in Left Ventricular End Systolic Volume (LVESV)
other_outcome.description: Median LVESV data, as measured by TTE at 6, 12, and 24 months compared to baseline

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Device Success
other_outcome.description: Device success is defined as deployment of the Cardioband, with MR reduction at hospital discharge.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Patient Success
other_outcome.description: Individual patient success (measured at 6 months and 1 year) defined as device success and the following: Discharged from index hospitalization NYHA class improvement by at least 1 level from baseline

other_outcome.measure: Number of Days Alive and Out of Hospital
other_outcome.description: Days alive and out of hospital due to major cardiovascular events at 1 year

other_outcome.measure: Freedom From All-cause Mortality and Major Adverse Events (AE)
other_outcome.time_frame: 30 days from implant procedure or hospital discharge, whichever is later.
other_outcome.description: Freedom from all-cause mortality and major AE is defined as disabling stroke, myocardial infarction (MI) (peri-procedural or spontaneous), renal failure requiring dialysis, life-threatening bleeding, cardiac tamponade and device related cardiac surgical intervention at 30 days from the implant procedure or hospital discharge, whichever is later.
Number of patients who undergo urgent/emergent surgical intervention post procedure

arm_group.description: Mitral valve repair with Cardioband implanted via transcatheter procedure under transesophageal echocardiography (TEE) and fluoroscopy guidance

intervention.description: Mitral valve repair with Cardioband implanted via transcatheter procedure under transesophageal echocardiography (TEE) and fluoroscopy guidance

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age ≥18 years
2. Severe (3+ to 4+) secondary Mitral Regurgitation
3. Symptomatic heart failure (NYHA Class III-IVa) despite guideline directed medical therapy including CRT if indicated
4. The Local Site Heart Team concur that surgery will not be offered as a treatment option and that medical therapy is the intended therapy.
5. Transfemoral access and transseptal deployment of the Cardioband is determined to be feasible
6. Subject is willing and able to provide informed consent and follow protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
1. EF < 20%
2. LVEDD ≥ 70 mm
3. Heavily calcified annulus or leaflets
4. Significant CAD requiring revascularization
5. Active bacterial endocarditis
6. Any percutaneous coronary, carotid, endovascular intervention or carotid surgery within 30 days or any coronary or endovascular surgery within 3 months
7. Renal insufficiency requiring dialysis
8. Life expectancy of less than twelve months
9. Subject is participating in concomitant research studies of investigational products that have not reached their primary endpoint
10. Pulmonary hypertension ≥ 70mmHg at rest
11. Mitral valve anatomy which may preclude proper device treatment
12. Right-sided congestive heart failure with echocardiographic evidence of severe right ventricular dysfunction and/or severe tricuspid regurgitation
13. Severe liver disease
14. Patient is pregnant or lactating
15. Hypersensitivity to Nickel or Chromium
16. Clinically significant bleeding diathesis or coagulopathy
17. History of mitral valve repair
18. TIA or CVA within 3 months

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Cardioband
group.description: Patients who were enrolled and had the Cardioband procedure attempted

group.title: Cardioband
group.description: Patients who were enrolled and had the Cardioband procedure attempted

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: EuroScore II
measure.description: The European System for Cardiac Operative Risk Evaluation (EuroSCORE) II is a risk model which allows the calculation of the risk of death after a heart operation. EuroScore II risk levels are as follows: Low risk: <8 Moderate risk: 8-10 High risk: >10

measure.title: NYHA Functional Class III or IV
measure.description: NYHA Classification - The stages of heart failure: Class I - No symptoms and no limitation in ordinary physical activity. Class II - Mild symptoms and slight limitation during ordinary activity. Class III - Marked limitation in activity due to symptoms, even during less-than-ordinary activity. Comfortable only at rest. Class IV - Severe limitations. Experiences symptoms even while at rest.

measure.title: Ischemic Etiology of Regurgitation
Dilated Cardiomyopathy
Previous Coronary Artery Bypass Graft
Chronic Renal Disease
Paroxysmal, Persistent, Chronic Atrial Flutter/Fibrillation

outcome.description: Freedom from all-cause mortality and major AE is defined as disabling stroke, myocardial infarction (MI) (peri-procedural or spontaneous), renal failure requiring dialysis, life-threatening bleeding, cardiac tamponade and device related cardiac surgical intervention at 30 days from the implant procedure or hospital discharge, whichever is later.

event.description: One patient experienced two Atrial Fibrillation adverse events (one serious and one non-serious). Both episodes are reported for this patient, one under Serious Adverse Events and the other under Other (Not Including Serious) Adverse Events.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
